wikipedia_page.main: John Hughes (14 June 1903 – 20 February 1977) was a British architect. In 1932 he won a gold medal in the art competitions of the Olympic Games for his design of a "Sports and Recreation Centre with Stadium, for the City of Liverpool".

response: | 1 || align="left"| John Hughes || align="left"|
A notable example of interwar council housing is St. Andrew's Gardens (1935) by the then director of housing Lancelot Keay & John Hughes, now used as student accommodation.
File:St Andrew's Gardens, Liverpool (2).JPG|St Andrew's Gardens, by Lancelot Keay, John Hughes(1935; Grade II)
* John Hughes (1903–77) (BArch 1931): joint architect of St Andrew's GardensDunne & Richmond (2008), p31
* John Hughes designed St Andrews Gardens
*1932 - 1932 Summer Olympics gold medal for town planning awarded to John Hughes (architect) for city of Liverpool sports stadium.
